p: VACV encodes numerous intracellular Bcl-2-like proteins that inhibit different stages of the signaling cascades of the nuclear transcription factor NF-ÎºB and/or IRF3 activation [ 40]. Removal of the gene of each of the four proteins from this family (C6, N1, K7, and A52) was shown to lead to increased production of NK cells, enhanced CD8 + T-cell immune response to VACV infection, and an increased protective effect (protectiveness) against re-infection [ 43- 46].
